org.jdesktop.core.animation.timing

Class Animator.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdesktop.core.animation.timing.Animator.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    Animator

    @NotThreadSafe
 @TrackPartiallyInitialized
public static class Animator.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to construct Animator instances.

    The default values are listed in the table below.

    Method Description Default
    addTarget(TimingTarget) gets timing events while the animation is running none
    Animator.setDefaultTimingSource(TimingSource) or Animator.Builder(TimingSource) a timing source for the animation none
    setDuration(long, TimeUnit) the duration of one cycle of the animation 1 second
    setDisposeTimingSource(boolean) if the TimingSource used by the animation should be disposed at the end of the animation. false
    setEndBehavior(Animator.EndBehavior) what happens at the end of the animation Animator.EndBehavior.HOLD
    setInterpolator(Interpolator) the interpolator for each animation cycle LinearInterpolator
    setRepeatBehavior(Animator.RepeatBehavior) the repeat behavior of the animation Animator.RepeatBehavior.REVERSE
    setRepeatCount(long) the number of times the animation cycle will repeat 1
    setStartDirection(Animator.Direction) the start direction for the initial animation cycle Animator.Direction.FORWARD
    setStartDelay(long, TimeUnit) a delay prior to starting the first animation cycle after the call to Animator.start() or Animator.startReverse(). none
    setDebugName(String) a meaningful name for the animation used by the Animator.toString() method null

    Values can be "cloned" from another Animator or Animator.Builder using one of several copy methods provided by this class.

    Instances of this class are not thread safe and are intended to be thread-confined. However, the Animator objects produced are thread-safe.

    Author:
    Tim Halloran

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder()
      Constructs an animation builder instance using the default timing source.

      • Builder

        public Builder(TimingSource timingSource)
        Constructs an animation builder instance.
        Parameters:

        Constructs an animation builder instance using the default timing source.

    • Method Detail

      • addTarget

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder addTarget(TimingTarget target)
        Adds a TimingTarget to the list of targets that get notified of each timing event while the animation is running.

        TimingTargets will be called in the order they are added. Duplicate additions are ignored.

        Parameters:
        target - a TimingTarget object.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • addTargets

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder addTargets(java.util.Collection<TimingTarget> targets)
        Adds the collection of passed TimingTargets to the list of targets that get notified of each timing event while the animation is running.

        TimingTargets will be called in the order they are added. Duplicate additions are ignored.

        Parameters:
        targets - a collection of TimingTarget objects.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • addTargets

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder addTargets(TimingTarget... targets)
        Adds the collection of passed TimingTargets to the list of targets that get notified of each timing event while the animation is running.

        TimingTargets will be called in the order they are added. Duplicate additions are ignored.

        Parameters:
        targets - a collection of TimingTarget objects.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • setDebugName

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder setDebugName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the "debug" name of the animation. The default value is null .
        Parameters:
        name - a name of the animation. A null value is allowed.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • setDisposeTimingSource

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder setDisposeTimingSource(boolean value)
        Sets if the animation should invoke TimingSource.dispose() on its timing source when it ends. The default value is false.
        Parameters:
        value - true if the animation should invoke TimingSource.dispose() on its timing source when it ends, false if not.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • setDuration

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder setDuration(long value,
                                             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the duration of one cycle of the animation. The default value is one second.
        Parameters:
        value - the duration of the animation. This value must be >= 1.
        unit - the time unit of the value parameter. A null value is equivalent to setting the default unit of TimeUnit.SECONDS.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if value is not >= 1.

      • setEndBehavior

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder setEndBehavior(Animator.EndBehavior value)
        Sets the behavior at the end of the animation. The default value is Animator.EndBehavior.HOLD.
        Parameters:
        value - the behavior at the end of the animation. A null value is equivalent to setting the default value.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • setInterpolator

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder setInterpolator(Interpolator value)
        Sets the interpolator for each animation cycle. The default interpolator is the built-in linear interpolator.
        Parameters:
        value - the interpolation to use each animation cycle. A null value is equivalent to setting the default value.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • setRepeatBehavior

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder setRepeatBehavior(Animator.RepeatBehavior value)
        Sets the repeat behavior of the animation. The default value is Animator.RepeatBehavior.REVERSE.
        Parameters:
        value - the behavior for each successive animation cycle. A null value is equivalent to setting the default value.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • setRepeatCount

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder setRepeatCount(long value)
        Sets the number of times the animation cycle will repeat. The default value is 1.
        Parameters:
        value - number of times the animation cycle will repeat. This value must be >= 1 or Animator.INFINITE for animations that repeat indefinitely.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value is not >=1 or Animator.INFINITE.

      • setStartDirection

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder setStartDirection(Animator.Direction value)
        Sets the start direction for the initial animation cycle. The default start direction is Animator.Direction.FORWARD.
        Parameters:
        value - initial animation cycle direction. A null value is equivalent to setting the default value.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).

      • setStartDelay

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder setStartDelay(long value,
                                               java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the start delay of the animation. This sets a delay prior to starting the first animation cycle after the call to Animator.start() or Animator.startReverse(). The default value is 0 indicating no start delay.
        Parameters:
        value - the start delay of the animation. This value must be >= 0 where a value of 0 means no start delay.
        unit - the time unit of the value parameter. A null value is equivalent to setting the default unit of TimeUnit.SECONDS.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if value is not >= 0.

      • copy

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder copy(Animator from)
        Copies all values from the passed animator into this builder not including its timing source. The timing targets of the animation are copied as well.

        This method allows an animation to be used as a template for other animations and can simplify construction of a large number of similar animations.

        Parameters:
        from - an animation, ignored if null.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).
        See Also:
        copy(Animator, boolean)

      • copy

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder copy(Animator from,
                                      boolean copyTargets)
        Copies all values from the passed animator into this builder not including its timing source. The timing targets of the animation may optionally be copied as well.

        This method allows an animation to be used as a template for other animations and can simplify construction of a large number of similar animations.

        Parameters:
        from - an animation, ignored if null.
        copyTargets - true if timing targets should also be copied into this builder, false if not.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).
        See Also:
        copy(Animator)

      • copy

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder copy(Animator.Builder from)
        Copies all values from the passed animation builder into this builder not including its timing source. The timing targets of the animation are copied as well.

        This method allows an animation builder to be used as a template for other animations and can simplify construction of a large number of similar animations.

        Parameters:
        from - an animation builder, ignored if null.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).
        See Also:
        copy(Animator.Builder, boolean)

      • copy

        @NonNull
public Animator.Builder copy(Animator.Builder from,
                                      boolean copyTargets)
        Copies all values from the passed animation builder into this builder not including its timing source. The timing targets of the animation builder may optionally be copied as well.

        This method allows an animation builder to be used as a template for other animations and can simplify construction of a large number of similar animations.

        Parameters:
        from - an animation builder, ignored if null.
        copyTargets - true if timing targets should also be copied into this builder, false if not.
        Returns:
        this builder (to allow chained operations).
        See Also:
        copy(Animator.Builder)

      • build

        @NonNull
public Animator build()
        Constructs an animation with the settings defined by this builder.
        Returns:
        an animation.
